definition: A type of tree known for its strength and hard wood.
sentence: The old oak tree provided plenty of shade.

definition: The feet of a mammal, especially those having claws.
sentence: The cat licked its paws clean.

definition: A flattened structure of a higher plant, typically green and bladelike, that is attached to a stem.
sentence: The leaf fell gently to the ground.

definition: A piece of furniture for one person to sit on, with a back, legs, and sometimes arms.
sentence: He sat in his favorite chair by the window.

definition: A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a level surface for eating, writing, or working.
sentence: They gathered around the table for dinner.

definition: A large keyboard musical instrument with a wooden case enclosing a soundboard and metal strings, which are struck by hammers when the keys are pressed.
sentence: She played a beautiful melody on the piano.

definition: Of or at a fairly or comfortably high temperature.
sentence: The room was warm and cozy.

definition: A color intermediate between red and blue.
sentence: She wore a beautiful purple dress.

definition: A hinged barrier used to close an opening in a wall, fence, or hedge.
sentence: He opened the gate and walked into the garden.

definition: A flat panel or area on an electronic device such as a television, computer, or smartphone, on which images and data are displayed.
sentence: She watched the movie on a large screen.

definition: A stringed musical instrument played with the fingers or a pick.
sentence: He strummed the guitar and sang a song.

definition: Each of the twelve named periods into which a year is divided.
sentence: She has been living here for a month.

definition: A barrier enclosing or bordering a field, yard, etc., usually made of posts and wire or wood.
sentence: They built a fence around the backyard.

definition: A melody, especially one that characterizes a certain piece of music.
sentence: He hummed a cheerful tune.

definition: A series of notes differing in pitch according to a specific scheme, usually within an octave.
sentence: She practiced the musical scale on her flute.

definition: Measuring a small distance from end to end.
sentence: He wrote a short story for the competition.

definition: of considerable or relatively great size, extent, or capacity.
sentence: The large elephant moved slowly across the savannah.

definition: used to identify a specific set of people or things close at hand or being indicated.
sentence: These books on the shelf are all written by the same author.

definition: used to indicate a future action or state that is conditional on another event.
sentence: If I had more time, I would travel the world.

definition: of a more excellent or effective type or quality.
sentence: She is feeling much better after taking the medicine.

definition: located or situated on every side; surrounding.
sentence: We walked around the park several times.

definition: constituting number two in a sequence; coming after the first in time or order; 2nd.
sentence: She won second place in the marathon.

definition: take part in a violent struggle involving the exchange of physical blows or the use of weapons.
sentence: The two dogs began to fight over the bone.

definition: the external form or appearance characteristic of someone or something; the outline of an area or figure.
sentence: The shape of the cloud resembled a dragon.

definition: to have a particular belief, opinion, or idea about someone or something.
sentence: I think it will rain tomorrow.
